title: Marshmallow Hot Fudge Sauce Recipe
description: Marshmallows give this creamy hot fudge sauce a velvety texture for the ultimate topping for ice cream.

Chocolate Sauce and Hot Fudge Recipes Marshmallow Hot Fudge Sauce 4.9 (34) 29 Reviews 5 Photos A quick, easy, and smooth fudge sauce that's super easy to make with marshmallows, milk, and chocolate chips. Submitted by Jenny Updated on March 12, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 5 5 5 5 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 15 mins Servings: 16 Yield: 4 cups Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 16 servings 30 large marshmallows ⅔ cup milk ¼ cup butter ⅛ teaspoon salt 1 (12 ounce) package semisweet chocolate chips 1 ½ teaspoons vanilla extract Directions Gather all ingredients. Allrecipes / Preethi Venkatram Heat marshmallows, milk, butter, and salt in a saucepan over low heat until marshmallows melt, stirring often, about 5 minutes. Allrecipes / Preethi Venkatram Add chocolate chips and vanilla extract; continue stirring until chocolate is melted, 5 minutes more. Serve warm. Allrecipes / Preethi Venkatram I Made It Print 56 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 136 Calories 9g Fat 15g Carbs 1g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 16 Calories 136 % Daily Value * Total Fat 9g 12% Saturated Fat 6g 29% Cholesterol 8mg 3% Sodium 46mg 2% Total Carbohydrate 15g 5% Dietary Fiber 1g 4% Total Sugars 13g Protein 1g 3% Calcium 20mg 2% Iron 1mg 4% Potassium 93mg 2% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Marshmallow Hot Fudge Sauce 01 of 05 Photo by  Allrecipes / Preethi Venkatram 02 of 05 Photo by  AquaFrog8042 03/07/2025 This recipe is a keeper! So easy to make and tasted so good! 03 of 05 Photo by  joanzer 05/14/2020 04 of 05 Photo by  Miss Veekay 01/17/2019 Quick and easy and delicious will definately make it again. I used less marshmallows so that it wasn’t too sweet but it was perfect. 05 of 05 Photo by  Marianne 12/24/2012 Absolutely delicious and oh! so! easy! Excellent! I made half a batch, and that's probably a good thing! I had to finish rounding out my depleted supply of semisweet chips with milk chocolate, but I'm sure that didn't make any difference! Very delicious! 1 You’ll Also Love Easy Homemade Chocolate Sauce 135 Ratings Southern-Style Chocolate Gravy 316 Ratings Chocolate Puffed-Wheat Squares 3 Ratings Black Bottom Butterscotch Fudge 2 Ratings Minions Marshmallow Pops No Bake Toffee Fudge Bars 11 Ratings S'mores Cheesecake Cupcakes Nan's Peanut Butter Fudge with Marshmallows 3 Ratings Granddad's Peppermint Fudge Favorite S'mores Cookies Rocky Road Cookies with Marshmallows 3 Ratings Gooey S'mores Dip 16 Ratings Toasted Marshmallow Cupcakes 20 Ratings Eclair Cake with Chocolate Ganache 173 Ratings The Best Salted Brown Butter Rice Krispie Treats 143 Ratings Retro Bing Bars Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Jenny
instructions: Gather all ingredients. Allrecipes / Preethi Venkatram;Heat marshmallows, milk, butter, and salt in a saucepan over low heat until marshmallows melt, stirring often, about 5 minutes. Allrecipes / Preethi Venkatram;Add chocolate chips and vanilla extract; continue stirring until chocolate is melted, 5 minutes more. Serve warm. Allrecipes / Preethi Venkatram
